Stem: Fleshy, upright, hairless, green but often purple tinged.
Leaves: Very large spreading blade 20-60 cm long, oval shaped with pointed tip. Hairless with smooth edges. With thin false petals. The real petals are fused at the base.
Flowers: Showy red, yellow, or both. Singular or in pairs and arranged in larger branched clusters of 6-20.
FruitSeeds: Papery capsules 1.5-3 cm across, almost rounded in shape, splitting open to release numerous smooth black spherical or egg-shaped seeds.
Habitat: Riparian areas, wetlands, old gardens, disturbed areas, waste areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: False petals are thinner than in garden cannas (*Canna* hybrid species).
